summary: Build a shopping e-commerce mobile app named "AS FASHION" featuring fashion (men/women), shoes/heels, baby products, and makeup (e.g., lipstick), with a professional, attractive interface.
architectural_notes: Product catalog seeding must include valid image URLs/paths per product (and preferably multiple images per product) so product grids and PDPs always render imagery.
known_issues: Users report missing product images in the app/catalog (no pictures shown).

existing_features.title: Create the app identity and core layout for an e-commerce app named "AS FASHION" with a professional, beautiful interface, including a responsive header (brand + search), category navigation, and a consistent page shell (footer, spacing, typography). Use English for all user-facing text.

Implement a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, components styling, spacing, and product card style) and apply it consistently across all screens. Choose a distinct fashion-forward style (avoid the default look) and do not use a blue/purple primary palette.

Create storefront browsing for these product groups: Men (T-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants), Women (tops, jeans, kurta, sarees), Shoes (shoes, heels), Baby (baby clothing/products), Makeup (lipstick and other makeup). Provide category pages with product grids and filters appropriate for apparel (at minimum: price range and size where applicable).
Add product detail pages that show product images, name, price, description, selectable variants (e.g., size/color when applicable), and an "Add to Cart" action.

Implement a shopping cart experience: cart drawer or cart page, quantity adjustments, remove item, subtotal calculation, and a checkout screen that collects basic shipping fields (name, phone, address) and places an order (no external payment integration).

Support optional sign-in via Internet Identity to associate carts/orders with a logged-in Principal; allow anonymous browsing without login. If not logged in, cart can remain client-side only, but checkout must require login to place an order.

Frontend data layer: use React Query for fetching categories/products and for mutations (add to cart if server-based, create order). Include loading, empty, and error states for all primary screens (home, category, product detail, cart, checkout, orders).

Add generated static brand assets and basic merchandising visuals (logo + homepage hero banner + category tiles) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve them from the backend).

Add visible images for every product in the catalog, with special coverage for Sarees, Kurtas, Men’s T‑shirts, and Men’s shirts, so product cards and product detail pages always show real product pictures (not broken links).
Store the new product images as static frontend assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and update the backend seed catalog to reference these static paths in each product’s imageUrls array.
Expand apparel size variants to include XXL and XXXL (where applicable) and ensure size selection UI supports and correctly labels these sizes.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create the "AS FASHION" shopping app with a professional, beautiful UI for browsing and shopping across categories (men/women apparel, shoes/heels, baby products, makeup).

Backend: design and implement Motoko data models and APIs for categories, products (with variants), cart (if persisted), and orders. Seed an initial catalog suitable for AS FASHION including men/women apparel, Indian wear (kurta/sarees), shoes/heels, baby products, and makeup (including lipstick).
Add product images across the catalog (ensure each product has pictures), especially for sarees, kurtas, men’s T-shirts, and men’s shirts; display images on product cards and product detail pages.
Expand available size variants to include XXL and XXXL (where applicable) for apparel products.
Add more product collections (expand the catalog breadth) across key categories like sarees, kurtas, and men’s tops/shirts.

Add more product collections by expanding the seeded catalog with additional products across key categories, especially Sarees, Kurtas, Men’s T‑shirts, and Men’s shirts, each with images and appropriate sizes.
